intro: Semecarpus pubescens, commonly known as the hairy sycamore or Indian chestnut, is a deciduous tree native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its rough, fissured bark and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by woody, spiny fruits containing single seeds. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of its family, with adaptations suited to its native tropical and subtropical habitats.
